com.stefanmuenchow.collections.list
Interface ISmartList<E>

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Collection<E>, ISmartCollection<E>, java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.List<E>
public interface ISmartList<E>
extends java.util.List<E>, ISmartCollection<E>

Specifies the operations of SmartLists. SmartLists are compatible with the standard List interface, but add some functionality to them. They are implemented as simple decorators (see Gang of Four).

Author:
Stefan MÃ¼nchow

Method Detail

first

E first()
Returns the first element in the List. Similar to 
aList.get(0)

Returns:
First element

last

E last()
Returns the last element of the list. Similar to 
aList.get(aList.size() - 1)

Returns:
Last element

get

E get(int index,
      E defaultVal)
Gets the element at the specified index. If the index is not into the range od valid indices, the default value is returned.

Parameters:
index - Index of element to get
defaultVal - Default value
Returns:
Element at index or defaultVal, if index is out of bounds.

take

ISmartList<E> take(int n)
Takes the first n elements of the collection and returns the result. The original list is changed. Similar to 
aList.subList(0, n)

Parameters:
n - Number of elements to take from beginning of list
Returns:
Prefix list

drop

ISmartList<E> drop(int n)
Removes the first n elements of the collection and returns the result. The original list is changed. Similar to 
aList.subList(n, aList.size())

Parameters:
n - Number of elements to remove from beginning of list
Returns:
Postfix list

takeWhile

ISmartList<E> takeWhile(IPredicate<E> pred)
Takes elements from the List until the predicate evaluates to false the first time. The original list is changed.

Parameters:
pred - Predicate
Returns:
Prefix list

dropWhile

ISmartList<E> dropWhile(IPredicate<E> pred)
Removes elements from the List until the predicate evaluates to false the first time. The original list is changed.

Parameters:
pred - Predicate
Returns:
Postfix list

removeDuplicates

ISmartList<E> removeDuplicates()
Removes all duplicate values from the List.

Returns:
List without duplicates

intersperse

ISmartList<E> intersperse(E elem)
Inserts the specified elem between each two elements of the list.

Parameters:
elem - Element to insert
Returns:
List with elem at each 2nd index

zipWith

<T> ISmartMap<E,T> zipWith(java.util.List<T> anotherList)
Creates a SmartMap from two lists. Elements in the first list are the keys, elements with corresponding indices in the second list the values. If one of the lists has less elements than the other one, the elements are discarded.

Parameters:
anotherList - List to zip with
Returns:
Map

getIndicesList

ISmartList<java.lang.Integer> getIndicesList()
Returns a list of the indices. This is the same as the range from 0 to 
list.size() - 1
. The original list remains unchanged.

Returns:
List of indices

getOccurenceCountMap

ISmartMap<E,java.lang.Integer> getOccurenceCountMap()
Creates a Map with the elements of the list as keys and the number of their occurences in the list as values.

Returns:
Map

reverse

ISmartList<E> reverse()
Reverses the ordering of the elements in the list.

Returns:
Reversed list

sizeWithoutNulls

int sizeWithoutNulls()
Returns the list size without all null elements. If there are no null elements in list, it is equal to list.size().

Returns:
List size without null elements
